name: TheAtlantic
text: “Are you willing to hand over your freedom and create a health police state?” Worries about freedom and privacy are just one reason contact tracing isn't going well in the U.S., reports @olgakhazan: https://t.co/1Wduf0F3Rn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Depersonalizing climate change, such that the only answers are systemic, is a mistake ... It misses how social change is built on a foundation of individual practice," argues @AnnieLowrey: https://t.co/8s932qU6Kz

name: TheAtlantic
text: The writer F. T. Kola had COVID-19 in March, and she’s still dealing with the aftermath. She returns to the podcast Social Distance to ask about whether she should donate plasma, and if she should worry about “reinfection”: https://t.co/NsBVYMOJqC

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Again and again, we’ve seen anger, hostility, and sexism directed at women who have the audacity to seek power. (I have some firsthand experience with this.) Deep-seated biases are even harder to change than discriminatory laws." -- @HillaryClinton:
https://t.co/AkTNQ9zZOC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ten years ago, Katy Perry epitomized pop music. Today, there’s little trace of her shiny, happy sound on the charts. @skornhaber on what undid the “Teenage Dream” era—and led to Perry’s bummer new album, “Smile.” https://t.co/TtsMeNstFM

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Rights are important, but they are nothing without the power to claim them." @HillaryClinton reflects on the unfinished business of gender equality, 25 years after her own speech in Beijing. https://t.co/29pdb6uYb4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Twenty-five years ago in Beijing, @HillaryClinton declared that "women's rights are human rights." Here’s the full speech as she delivered it. https://t.co/fB3rOSnYQP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Kennedy hasn’t come up with a good rationale for challenging progressive Senator Ed Markey in Massachusetts. Today's primary will determine whether that matters, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/olFvlIaNJf
